name: ITP-015 - Drilling & Setting of Bonded Anchors
template name: ITP-015 - Drilling & Setting of Bonded Anchors

name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are using the complete set of the correct and most current drawings.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Project IFC Drawings and Drawings Register
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed Inspection & Test Plan (ITP)
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any works on site.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PMP, EMP, ECP, TMP, SWMS
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: PMP, EMP, ECP, TMP, SWMS
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed Inspection & Test Plan (ITP)
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any works on site.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All services are located, and the relevant service authorities have been consulted and permits obtained.
○ Ensure an excavation permit is issued and all involved personnel are briefed about the services in the area before signing onto the permit.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed Inspection & Test Plan (ITP)
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any works on site.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The bonded anchor installers, and all of its site personnel, shall be certified by the AEFAC, and shall provide evidence of this certification and of its competency acceptable to the Superintendent.

○ All personnel, including supervisory personnel, who are required to install bonded anchors shall also be trained on-site by the supplier of the bonded anchor system in the specific installation requirements of the project before bonded anchor installation works commence.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Standard Section 680, Clause 680.06
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed Inspection & Test Plan (ITP)
RESPONSIBILITY: Project Engineer/ Site Supervisor/ Superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure line and level of all bonded anchor holes is in accordance with design levels, survey files and drawings.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Project IFC Drawings and Survey Data
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed Inspection & Test Plan (ITP)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall not proceed with the permanent bonded anchor installation works until the trial system installation have been carried out and the outcomes reviewed and approved by the Superintendent.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Standard Section 680, Clause 680.11
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed Inspection & Test Plan (ITP)
RESPONSIBILITY: Project Engineer/ Site Supervisor/ Superintendent

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Contractor shall not proceed with drilling or cutting holes into the concrete, installation or removal of bonded anchor works until the WMS and ITPs have been reviewed and approved by the Superintendent.
○ Ensure hole depths and widths are drilled in accordance with Project IFC Drawings.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawing No.578259 – 578276, VicRoads Standard Section 680, Clause 680.11
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed Inspection & Test Plan (ITP)
RESPONSIBILITY: Project Engineer/ Site Supervisor/ Superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure materials being used are in accordance with standard specifications and design drawings.

○ Chemical adhesives shall be allowed to gain strength for the minimum time specified by the manufacturer’s installation instructions before torque is applied to bolts and load is applied to the bonded anchor system.

○ Ensure bonded anchor casting register is populated including relevant details such as cast date, cast time, ambient temperature and time of casting, material batch no., and material batch expiry date.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Signed Inspection & Test Plan (ITP)

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: One week prior to testing the Contractor shall submit to the Superintendent calibration certificates conforming to the requirements of AS 2193 Grade B for the jack and pressure gauges or other force measuring devise to be used.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Standard Section 680, Clause 680.09

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Details of the test method including load increments and duration of sustained loading shall be submitted to the Superintendent for review not later than one week prior to the testing.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Standard Section 680, Clause 680.09

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure a minimum of 20% of all bonded anchors subject to tensile loads, a combination of tensile and shear loads, or fatigue loads are tested and deemed to meet the minimum strength requirements.
— The Contractor shall provide a test report to the Superintendent for review.

— If a bonded anchor fails either the ultimate load testing for suitability or the bonded anchor proof load test, the Contractor shall submit rectification proposals for review by the Superintendent prior to any further bonded anchor installation.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Standard Section 680, Clause 680.09
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the SWA’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
